DataElement.preferredName: Post Obstruction Pneumonia Disease or Disorder Present Yes No Not Applicable Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The Yes/No/NA indicator of information related to the presence of post-obstructive pneumonia, an inflammation focally or diffusely affecting the lung parenchyma, caused by a blockage or obstruction of the airway.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Post Obstruction Pneumonia Disease or Disorder Present
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to the presence of post-obstructive pneumonia, an inflammation focally or diffusely affecting the lung parenchyma, caused by a blockage or obstruction of the airway.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.:Blockage of a passageway.:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Concepts.definition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.
Blockage of the normal flow of the contents of an anatomical passageway.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: Inflammation of the lungs.:Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: An acute, acute and chronic, or chronic inflammation focally or diffusely affecting the lung parenchyma, due to infections (viruses, fungi, mycoplasma, or bacteria), treatment (e.g. radiation), or exposure (inhalation) to chemicals. Symptoms include cough, shortness of breath, fevers, chills, chest pain, headache, sweating, and weakness.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredName: Chronic or Associated Diseases and Exposures
ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: chronic diseases, as well as diseases and exposures associated with cancer.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/not applicable.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

Concepts.longName: Yes, No, or Not Applicable Response
Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 04-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 8/3/2015 Corrections made to VD in order to restore to original format: removed C49486 as rep term and replaced with C49797; restored long name and definition per Dianne Reeves/tt.

ReferenceDocuments.name: If the patient has post-obstr
ReferenceDocuments.description: If the patient has post-obstructive pneumonia, do they no longer require intravenous antibiotics at the time of registration?
